intro: Anthospermum spathulatum subsp. uitenhagense, commonly known as the Uitenhagen's spathularium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves that are ovate to spatulate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white to pale yellow petals, typically arranged in cymes. Its fruit is a small capsule that dehisces to release seeds. This species is native to southern Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
